core

Class AbstractRepresentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractRepresentation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractRepresentation>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBulkRepresentation

    public abstract class AbstractRepresentation
extends AbstractComponent
implements java.lang.Comparable<AbstractRepresentation>
    Abstract formulation of a candidate representation. Basically, it servers as a controller "brain" of an agent with its respective input and output interfaces.

    Each representation must be evolvable meaning it has to implement the necessary mutation and recombination functions.

    Author:
    Istvan Fehervari

        numberOfInputs - Number of input connectors
        numberOfOutputs - Number of output connectors
        random - The random generator object used to construct this representation

      • isEvaluated

        public final boolean isEvaluated()
        Returns the state if this representation has been already evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if this representation is already evaluated, false otherwise.

      • setEvaluated

        public final void setEvaluated(boolean evaluated)
        Sets the evaluated flag for the representation. Candidates with evaluated flag will not be exectued by the ranking instance.

      • getFitness

        public final double getFitness()
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the fitness value of this representation. Throws an exception if this representation has not been evaluated yet.
        Returns:
        the fitness value of this representation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this representation has not been evaluated.
        See Also:
        AbstractRepresentation#isEvaluated isEvaluated} to check if a fitness value is already calculated.

      • setFitness

        public final void setFitness(double fitness)
        Sets the fitness of this representation to the given value. Set the evaluated flag to true.
        Parameters:
        fitness - The new fitness value.

      • exportToFile

        public abstract void exportToFile(java.io.File saveFile)
        Exports the content of this representation to a file. Format and type is custom defined.
        Parameters:
        saveFile - The file to be saved to

      • mutate

        public final void mutate(float severity,
          float probability,
          int method)
        Initiates a mutation on this representation with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        severity - Should be between 0..1, interpreted by the representation.
        probability - Should be between 0..1, probability for one genome to be mutated.
        method - Selected mutation method. Use getNumberofMutationFunctions() to obtain the number of implemented methods.

      • mutate

        public void mutate(java.lang.String functionName,
          java.lang.Object... args)
        Initiates a mutation with the given name

      • xOverWith

        public final void xOverWith(AbstractRepresentation other,
             int method)
        Modifies this representation based on the implemented recombination function and the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        other - The other representation used for the recombination function.
        method - Selected recombination method. Use getNumberOfRecombinationFunctions() to obtain the number of implemented functions.

      • getNumberofMutationFunctions

        public abstract int getNumberofMutationFunctions()
        Returns the number of implemented mutation functions.
        Returns:
        the number of mutation functions implemented by this class.

      • getNumberOfRecombinationFunctions

        public abstract int getNumberOfRecombinationFunctions()
        Returns the number of implemented crossover functions.
        Returns:
        the number of recombination functions implemented by this class.

      • getOutput

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> getOutput(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> input)
        Processes the given list of inputs and returns the corresponding output values. The output values must be within the range of 0..1.
        Parameters:
        input - The list of input values to be processed.
        Returns:
        a list of output values.

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the representation to its base state. Typically this is meant to erases cache for representations possessing some memory.

      • diffTo

        public abstract double diffTo(AbstractRepresentation representation)
        Compares this representation to another one. Basically, this function should provide a value measuring the distance from another representation of the same type.
        Parameters:
        representation - The other representation to compare to.
        Returns:
        a value representing the distance between the two candidates.

        public final AbstractRepresentation clone()
        Returns a clone of this representation in a form of a deep copy.

        Returns:
        a deep copy of this representation.

      • exportToXmlElement

        public abstract void exportToXmlElement(org.dom4j.Element element)
        Exports this representation and all its necessary data to the provided XML element. The representation must be reconstructible from the saved data using loadFromXML(Node).
        Parameters:
        element - The root element to be used for saving.

      • loadFromXML

        public abstract AbstractRepresentation loadFromXML(org.dom4j.Node node)
        Reconstructs this representation from the given XML node.
        Parameters:
        node - The root XML node to load the data from.
        Returns:
        a newly created representation built from the provided data.

      • getDetails

        public abstract java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDetails()
        Returns a table of key-value pairs that describes this representation. This data is mostly used to visualize this specific representation instance.
        Returns:
        a human-readable table about the details/configuration of this specific instance

      • getHash

        public abstract java.lang.String getHash()
        Returns a hash of this representation instance calculated by its parameters/structure. This is used to give the candidate a name for identification. The length should be 4-6 characters.
        Returns:
        a hash of this representation instance.

        Compares this representation to another one based on their fitness values.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
